alert.note: Alert for Riverside; San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 23 at 3:33PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of the Inland Empire and the San Bernardino County mountains in Riverside and San Bernardino counties. * WHEN...Until 630 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 330 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Riverside, San Bernardino, Fontana, Moreno Valley, Ontario, Corona, Rialto, Chino, Redlands, Yucaipa, I-15 Through The Cajon Pass, Lake Arrowhead, Rancho Cucamonga, Chino Hills, Upland, Highland, Colton, Montclair, Norco and Loma Linda. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
